intro: Lennoa madreporoides subsp. pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous areas. Its leaves are arranged in a basal rosette and are generally narrow and linear. The flowers are yellow and produce small, round pods that contain several seeds.
